item.title: Material Planner
item.description:
Description

Position:           Material Planner
Location:          Kitchener, Ontario
Job Type:         Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     2-4 Years of relevant experience
Education:       Degree or Diploma in relevant field
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech.. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023. 

Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.

About the Job

As Clearpath grows exponentially and continues to design and build robots full of awesomeness, we
need someone to come in to aid in the purchase of super awesome robot parts! With more robots
shipping out than ever before, we’re looking for a Material Planner to join the team and keep up
with our growth. This position offers the best mix of responsibility, challenge, and enjoyment. We’re
looking for someone who can come in, take charge, and help keep our supply chain running
smoothly.

As our Material Planner, you will work among our fantastic Supply Chain/Operations Team within
OTTO Motors, Clearpath’s Industrial division. You will wear many hats, work with every department
in our company, and be around the coolest robots you can imagine. (Bonus points if you’re friends
with cool robots…we’ll hire them too!). You will be responsible for ensuring the availability of all
necessary materials required to support the manufacturing process, release scheduling of
inbound raw materials and components, and ensuring adequate stock levels for production
requirements.

About You

You want to work for a growing, yet thriving, company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are
driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You
want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.
You’ll like being the point person for purchasing concerns. You are motivated by making an impact
on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some
form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Your primary responsibilities will be:
  • Translate the build rate plan forecast into material suggestions considering suppliers’ lead times, material on hand, minimum level quantities, etc.
  • Utilize the MRP functionality in Epicor and verify system suggestions before sending them off to the purchasing team
  • Run different production scenarios to find out cost of material commitment for the different forecasts
  • Responsible for translating the Engineering Change Process outcome into inventory to update or add new planning parameters for parts being added or updated
  • Understand product demand and update minimum on hand and other planning parameters as necessary
  • Direct various departments on how to utilize the system through completing inventory transactions keeping costing and on hand quantities correct
  • Work with the engineering team to collect costing data on new projects being launched and determine BOM costing in advance
  • Administer BOM costing reports and completing comparative analysis to determine
    costing trends for our products
  • Manage our consumable VMI vendor by setting up new parts, removing parts as they become obsolete and leading the engineering change process when a part is no longer available.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Degree or Diploma in a relevant field
  • 2-4 years in material management
  • MRP experience
  • Strong business acumen and understanding of procurement process
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skill
  • Able to quickly evaluate and assess a problem situation and prioritize courses of action
  • Being comfortable in a customer-facing situation, and acting with professionalism in each of those instances
Bonus points for:
  • Experience with Epicor and Source Day
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Stock Room Controller
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:          Stock Room Controller  

Location:          Kitchener           

Experience:    1 -3 years           

Education:       Diploma              

 About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

Reporting into our Inventory Manager, you are the gatekeeper of Clearpath’s inventory and will support all Stock Room activities. Ensuring inventory levels are reflected accurately within our system is a top priority and you’re not afraid to get your hands dirty to investigate any discrepancies. You will work closely with our Production and Shipping teams to help materials flow smoothly between departments, and arrive at their destinations on time. No day is the same – being adaptable to change and curveballs won’t make you break a sweat! Where others see barriers, you see opportunities for improvements.

Responsibilities include:

Support our Production team

  • Create builds in our system based on new robot orders.
  • Provide smooth transition between inventory kit hand-off to production.
  • Work closely with Production Supervisor and personnel to ensure progress is on schedule.
  • Work with the Stock Room team to pick kits throughout the week.
  • Ensure the Shortage report is accurate and up to date. Notify Inventory Manager about any shortages.
  • Monitor all kits that are created with shortages and take appropriate action when parts arrive.
  • Reconcile completed production builds in our system at the end of the week.

Inventory Control

  • Be aware of everything and everyone that enters/leaves our Stock Room.
  • Process inventory requests/adjustments:
    • Make inventory adjustments daily (Ensure proper budget and project are being used).
    • Ensure accuracy: System matches inventory movement.
    • Look into odd requests, and take appropriate action.
    • Participate in cycle counting to ensure inventory accuracy.
    • Work with shipping department to move materials between Clearpath’s 3 locations when needed.

Other duties:

  • Keep the stock room Clean: Follow weekly schedule for dedicated times to cleanup/consolidate/reorganize. 
  • Work with Quality to coordinate repaired parts back into inventory.
  • Lead daily stand up meeting with Stock Room team to go over tasks.

 About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required skills:

  • 1- 3 years inventory control experience
  • Exceptional analytical and troubleshooting capabilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and written.
  • Detailed oriented with excellent follow-up practices. Acute attention to detail.
  • Ability to keep accurate and up-to-date records and logs. Record, itemize, collate, and tabulate data. Strong organizational, prioritizing, and multitasking skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with ability to influence and persuade others (internal and external).

 
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:             Account Executive
Location:             Waterloo, Ontario              
Experience:        3+ years\' experience
Division:              Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a well organized, relationship-oriented Account Engineer with proven skills across all account functions: business development, direct technical sales, and account management.

As our newest Account Executive, your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Review client projects and applications, and assist in the scoping & configuration of application-appropriate robotic solutions for customers, independently and in collaboration with our team of Engineers 
  • Gains customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating product features and software
  • Submits orders by conferring with technical support staff and costing engineering changes.
  • Provide company, product, and technical overview presentations
  • Provide pre-sales quotes to customers in a timely manner
  • Check purchase orders for accuracy against the quote or standards before processing Provide technical assistance to the customers - answering technical queries and perform research when answers are not immediately available
  • Successfully promote and sell Clearpath as a full-service robotic solutions provider
  • Maintain and develop a high level of knowledge of new technology and the company’s solution offerings
  • Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, 

About You

Our next Account Executive is a sharp, articulate and collaborative person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to everyone from grad students to CEOs to rocket scientists. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that attacks new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

You have an innate drive to be successful, and you bring both the acumen and the grit to achieve your objectives.

Our ideal candidate is someone who is described by friends as:

  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Able to understand and communicate technical concepts
  • Exceptional organization and attention to detail
  • Dynamic, dependable and diligent
  • Highly motivated and self-starting
  • Passion for helping customers solve complex problems with innovative technology

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3 years’ experience of proven excellence in business development, inside sales and/or sales
  • Technical degree or equivalent experience
  • Ability to translate technology features into business benefits
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong initiative and ability to work in a self-directed environment
  • Organization and priority setting skills and ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity and expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Sales Applications Engineer (Remote/Virtual - USA/Canada)
item.description:
Description

Position:            Applications Engineer
Location:            Remote/Virtual (USA/Canada)
Job Type:           Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years
Education:          Bachelor\'s degree in engineering or a related field
Division:            OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will work as a member of the OTTO Motors’ sales organization in an applications technical role as a partner to our account executives. You will be accountable for understanding customer requirements, selecting the best products, and devising solutions that ultimately improve our customer’s business and that meet or exceed the application requirements. You will also consult with channel partners and internal deployment teams to devise deployment plans that achieve the best time-to-value for the end users.  

You will be constantly interacting with customers, learning new technology, developing new system concepts, creating the foundation for successful projects, and impressing clients via virtual and in-person demonstrations of how their business can improve using our products. 

This role requires an awareness and proficiency with systems engineering, industrial engineering, project planning, and it involves interacting with many elements of our business.  

Responsibilities:

  • Be a pre-sales product knowledge expert, technical consultant, and content creator throughout the sales cycle.  Acquired understanding of Otto vehicle deployment methods including software functionality, safety limits, and hardware specifications.
  • Collect and review project information in order to adequately evaluate the customer’s application
  • Create and propose technical solutions for the customer’s application that includes the effective use of OTTO AMR’s, the definition of third-party vehicle attachments, and integration to the customers material handling infrastructure. 
  • Effectively document, present, and explain the proposed OTTO solution to the customer and their Engineering, Production, and Executive team members
  • Enable deployment teams by supplying solution concepts, project risks, and preliminary project plans
  • Be a trusted technical resource for customers and partners throughout the pre-sales process
  • Collect and communicate market data and ideas to our product management organization to improve the market success of our existing and future products
  • Contribute to department improvement initiatives to enhance the team’s efficiency and the value of its contributions to the business

Common Tasks:

  • Review customer RFQ/RFP type documents
  • Collaborate with the Sales Account Managers throughout the sales process; including sales calls, strategy, solutioning, and business-case proposals.
  • Visit customer sites to evaluate material handling operations, processes, existing equipment, and floor layout constraints
  • Utilize Excel to review customer data, evaluate fleet size, cycle time analysis
  • Utilize 2D CAD (DraftSight) to evaluate the facility layout, project feasibility and concepting
  • Work with Third-party attachment providers and System Integrators to concept and budget custom material handling solutions that will interface with the Otto standard product line
  • Review proposals and budgets with the Sales Account Managers
  • Prepare and present slide decks of the overall project scope to the Customer
  • Preparing project specific responsibility matrices for Customer and Otto teams
  • Perform product demonstrations at Customer sites
  • Collaborate with Otto’s Project, Product, and Systems Engineering Teams

Required Skills:

  • Engineering Degree or technical background with experience in Manufacturing, Industrial, Process or Mechanical Engineering
  • Strong understanding of complex integrated systems, material handling, mechanical and industrial equipment and processes. 
  • Experience working directly with sales and customers
  • Proficiency in 2D and 3D CAD software (i.e. AutoCAD, DraftSight, SolidWorks, etc)
  • Able to generate professional and impactful presentations (Powerpoint/Google)
  • Able to effectively communicate and present proposed solutions to customers
  • Able to quickly identify operational challenges and propose mitigation strategies
  • Able to facilitate productive technical discussion both internally and externally
  • Able to identify and communicate the value of OTTO’s proposed solution to the customer

Bonus Points:

  • Experience working with automated vehicles (i.e. AMRs or AGVs)
  • Experience working on projects involving material handling automation, Conveyors, Palletized lines, Automated Storage and Retrieval
  • Experience as a project manager or project engineer
  • Experience with Simulation software (Digital Twin, Event or Process Simulation)

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high-quality data, and a data-product-oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology-driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web visualizations, we do it all!

 

Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data-driven decision-making and the accelerated adoption of AI.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2-4 years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineering Consultant
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

As a ML Engineer at TELUS, you’ll be in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and most creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Strategists. You will be part of the journey we’re on to better understand our customers, to predict their needs and interaction behavior. With your expert knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, you will contribute to the development of state-of-the-art ML & AI driven solutions. Our team works in a fun, innovative, and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Marketing, Strategy & Data Insights team in our Home Solutions and Mobility business.

 

  • We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high-value and high-visibility projects
  • We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
  • You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools


What you’ll do

 

  • Support and evolve the AI Insights roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices, and emerging tools/technologies
  • Study and transform data science prototypes and design machine learning systems according to requirements for production
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Execute, oversee, and evolve production ML models and algorithm selection to deliver solutions that are relevant and facilitate decision-making.
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI 
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities
  • Responsible for end-to-end engagement from problem definition to insight delivery as well as value realization & measurement

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You have 5 + years experience in a data related position
  • Extensive experience with ML frameworks, platforms and tools, and expert knowledge with GCP
  • You have solid development experience with Python and are comfortable with using GitHub and other programing languages
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles
  • You are capable of delivering technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You are a collaborative, creative, open-minded individual who possesses a natural curiosity and desire to experiment
  • You have the ability to communicate effectively to gather advanced Data Science requirements from Director-level stakeholders and communicate finding/insights in clear concise manner; ability to create/deliver impactful presentations


Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Google Professional ML Engineering Certification
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, or Looker
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA, Monday.com, etc.) #LI-Remote

item.title: Manager - Information Services (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

 

Ready to showcase your top-notch DevOp leadership expertise?


Join our team

 

The Capability and Modernization team is a niche team with large scope. We get things done, from system integrations, workflow customization, data science, data aggregation and visualization, reporting, business enablement and special strategic initiatives. We have a finger on the pulse supporting TELUS’ Network Build Operations business units with thousands of team members.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You’re a strategic thinker with an expert level skill for capturing business insights and applying them to learning and business decision opportunities for TELUS’ Capability and Modernization team. This highly recognized team has a proven track record for building next-generation technology roadmaps and delivering best-in-class solutions. You will partner with peers, senior leaders and stakeholders to drive out transformational business opportunities using our cutting edge technology platforms. Today, you could be helping us further develop and deliver our innovative solutions across TELUS teams.

 

Here’s how

 

  • An in-depth understanding of DevOps practices and experience on maintaining a culture of continuous improvements
  • Display technical leadership on the implementation, deployment, delivery, and the operations of technical solutions managed by the CM team
  • Identify opportunities to strengthen the Capability and Modernization practices such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring team members and contractors, building and attending communities of practice and networking with peers
  • Identify and define new process and/or system improvement opportunities
  • Provide specialized consulting, analytical and technical support
  • Works across TELUS IT teams to ensure systems, platform upgrades, network upgrades and security deployments are implemented with minimal impact to production environments
  • Participate in architecture and design review sessions
  • Support revenue generating and cost saving initiatives across business teams - CNP, NBO & CTE 
  • Work with CM SMEs and Development teams in system troubleshooting and performance tuning
  • Provide on-call support of operational issues when necessary
  • Produce documentation related to services, solutions and interfaces
  • Keep informed on technology trends, DevOps, business strategy and continuously develop your own expertise and knowledge
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 5 years experience with DevOps delivery
  • 5 years experience leading, coaching, mentoring, and developing technical people and teams
  • A progressive thought leader who can empower and energize high performing people
  • Proven experience managing system changes without interruption to teams and users
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and example
  • An ability to drive to big picture goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to detail
  • An ability to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints
  • Experience automating workflows
  • Experience with API and system integrations

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience working in matrix organizational structures in large enterprise organizations
  • Mulesoft and API integration experience
  • Atlassian and Appian workflow development experience 
  • AI & Machine Learning exposure
  • GSuite
  • Prior experience operationalizing enterprise IT systems including processes, governance, and team resources

item.title: DataOps Engineer
item.description:
We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team, our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment.

 

We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

Join our team


We are searching for a talented candidate to join our team in the role of DataOps Engineer. Reporting to the Manager – Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms, the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting solutions to enable business product teams to drive value by realizing Analytics and Machine Learning use cases. This role will support our evolving DataOps landscape by providing analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, improved speed to market and automation.  This role will be an agent of change and support our evolving strategy, data, and analytics roadmaps as well as provide strong direction for our Cloud based Analytics and Business Intelligence platforms.  
 

Here\'s How:

 

  • Collaborating with Business and Product teams to enable valuable Analytics and Machine Learning use cases
  • Designing and implementing DataOps and MLOps processes and automations using the latest tools to effectively operationalize Analytics and AI workflows
  • Staying up to date of new software, tools, and organizations that are having an impact on the Analytics and Machine Learning landscape
  • Provisioning infrastructure and secure, reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP for Data & Analytics users across the TELUS enterprise
  • Identify opportunities to make substantial improvements to the deployment and support of our DataOps environment demonstrating a DevOps mindset while improving our reliability and speed to market
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including building highly collaborative relationships with business product teams and technical teams

 


What you bring

 

  • You are passionate about Agile culture and DevOps practices
  • Your have a keen interest in Data Analytics and Machine Learning, and are familiar with the machine learning life cycle
  • Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform (e.g. BigQuery, Dataproc, Dataflow, Vertex AI)
  • You have experience in implementing CI/CD processes and integrating source code version control (e.g. GitHub) with automated workflows.
  • You have hands on experience in Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g. Terraform, Pulumi) and the Python programming language
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters, and are able to translate technical considerations into business implications 
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and working on strategic initiatives
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Undergrad in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Science or equivalent
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with data/analytics platforms, DevOps, and/or machine learning
  • GCP Professional Certification

item.title: RAN (Radio Access Network) Development - Engineer II
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. The RAN Development & New Service Introduction team is a group of highly motivated engineers who have a passion for developing and implementing new technologies to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service. You will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning but also to build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software, and feature new technology introduction
  • Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
  • Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement
  • Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
  • Plan the execution of the TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution
  • Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc
  • Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Solid knowledge of LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience)
  • Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology
  • Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance
  • Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols
  • Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP-based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets
  • 5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
  • Ability to provide on-demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of several wide-ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer-focused basis
  • Familiar with wireless network troubleshooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Master degree in telecom P.Eng or Eng designation

item.title: Privacy Engineer (Remote)
item.description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

 

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customer’s privacy and to earn and maintain their trust.

 

We see compliance with the law as our starting point and we passionately pursue opportunities to demonstrate respect for our customers and their data through transparent, robust, and ethical data practices.

 

Our team takes pride in earning a reputation for being innovative thought leaders, strategic business partners and subject-matter experts in privacy and data governance.

Description

 

The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As the Privacy Engineer, supported by the Director of Privacy & Innovation, you will materially influence the ongoing development of TELUS’ business innovation focused on supporting the growth of the business along with the development, deployment, and use of new digital technologies.

 

You will collaborate with, advise and guide the business to embed privacy by design principles from the first stages of development to ensure data practices meet our rigorous privacy, security and ethical standards, and in a manner that demonstrates TELUS commitment to putting customers and their privacy first.

 

You will be an integral member of the Data & Trust Office.  This team is tasked with solving some of our organization\'s most complex challenges while building a thriving community of practice around data ethics and data governance.

 

You will be a champion for Privacy & Innovation and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission.

 

Here’s how:

 

  • Identity opportunities to build or procure privacy-enhancing technologies, including to support the use of de-identification and synthetic data
  • Advise on how privacy-enhancing technologies can serve as an enabler for business program operations and assist with their deployment within the organization
  • Architect solutions to enable algorithmic fairness and explainability, data quality monitoring, and the development and implementation of data validation and testing strategies
  • Support the development of a data analytics program to deploy or leverage technology responsibly and ethically always in a manner that demonstrates TELUS’ commitment to putting customers and their privacy first
  • Develop the design and documentation of processes that standardize best practices in privacy engineering and support an agile development methodology
  • Educate and advise business units on existing or new data uses, and provide innovative strategies and creative solutions to address privacy, compliance and data governance considerations
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure adherence to the TELUS’ Trust Model

 

 

Qualifications

 

You are the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Demonstrated track record of providing subject matter expertise in embedded privacy by design into product and services while delivering on measurable outcomes for our customers and our businesses in a highly complex stakeholder environment
  • Familiarity with privacy-enhancing technologies (e.g. differential privacy, federated learning, synthetic data, etc.) and demonstrated working knowledge or understanding of software engineering fundamentals and lifecycle development
  • Familiarity with statistics, algorithms, and machine learning tools to analyze and evaluate fair and ethical AI
  • Passionate about privacy, data ethics and the imperative to use data to solve big and small problems
  • Keen to explore new and creative solutions to change the trajectory of persistent challenges and motivated to bring those solutions to life
  • Appreciated for your excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills, and your ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems into clear, actionable requirements
  • Known for your ability to influence and negotiate effectively, to be a persuasive advocate, and known for your conflict resolution skills with a focus on win-win solutions
  • Sought out for excellent communication skills, verbal & written, with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization and leadership forums
  • 3-5 years experience in privacy / data protection or a graduate degree or concentration in privacy engineering
  • Post-secondary degree in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, privacy engineering, or related field of study
  • Certification in Privacy (e.g., CDPSE, CIPT, CIPM, CIPP certification)

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience is proactively embedding privacy considerations into product design
  • Experience with the development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data management, and data integration processes
  • Experience with design for software applications running on multiple platforms
  • Experience with web architecture and the privacy and security model of the web
  • Bilingual in French & English, verbal and/or written

 

#LI-REMOTE

DTOJOBS2023

item.title: Senior Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Join our team 

 

Become part of a future friendly national team, one that embraces change and initiates opportunity, has a passion for growth, believes in spirited teamwork, and has the courage to innovate. Our success is based as much on your dedication and hard work as it is on the innovative television, internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As part of our Smart Cities and Home Services team, you will imagine, create, support and test innovative smart cities and live streaming services for TELUS. This is an opportunity for you to develop solutions and designs for streaming video while providing our customers with the best video streaming experiences. We’re stretching the boundaries of what is possible, and supporting and enabling local communities to expand their audiences.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Provide leadership and architectural support for CI/CD pipeline and software development practices for a small team of developers
  • Create, test, and support new systems and services that you help create, operating in a dev-ops team.
  • Bring familiarity with building and using containers and other cloud-native tools
  • Develop new architectures and technologies to deliver the best viewing experience for our customers.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and architecture
  • Apply best practices of software development in different frameworks and troubleshoot integration issues
  • Automate service testing to ensure reliable and repeatable results.
  • Ensure a high level of code quality and integrity in software development projects
  • Work with Project Managers and Network Planners to ensure the successful delivery of projects
  • An understanding of the importance of automation and continuous integration and deployment

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of software development experience utilizing CI/CD practices and agile methodologies
  • Extensive experience with cloud-native tools and cloud environments (GCP and AWS)
  • Capable of mentoring developers and sharing your knowledge
  • Strong troubleshooting methodology
  • An interest in video streaming technologies
  • Insatiable curiosity for problem solving, technology and innovation
  • Desire to learn and take on new challenges
  • Ability to collaborate with diverse groups and technical teams
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Having a creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, talented at developing and fostering positive relationships with other team members
  • Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Python, Java, C#
  • MySQL, MongoDB or equivalent databases
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Ansible
  • GitHub, AzureDevops, BitBucket, or equivalent source control repositories
  • Github Workflows, ArgoCD, Google CloudBuild, Helm or equivalent CI-CD pipeline tools
  • Adaptive bitrate streaming including HLS, DASH, and CDN technologies
  • Video analytics powered by machine learning technologies

FFHJOBS

item.title: API & Data Management Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions. We are doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling and high quality data. We have a data-product and data platform oriented culture and we are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As an API & Data Management Developer in the Metadata Management Program, you’ll contribute to the design, development and support of a variety of integration and process automation techniques to ensure accurate ingestion of technical metadata from many source systems. You will design and develop APIs to enable programmatic consumption of metadata by consumers external to the metadata management platform. In addition you will ensure reliable and consistent processing to our Collibra cloud platform and automate information lifecycle management processes using web enabled workflows.

 

As a trusted technical expert, you will collaborate with various business units and demonstrate thought leadership when sitting at the intersection between privacy, ethics, technology, data and consumers to ensure it is leveraged in a respectful manner while continuing to advance our reputation of being trustworthy through transparent communication.

Here’s How

 

  • Work with business stakeholders on the adoption and onboarding of the TELUS Metadata Management Tool powered by Collibra (training and technical support)
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to define integration approaches, identify the best techniques, ensure capture and storage of all available metadata, ensure durable API processing is available to subscription customers
  • Support and maintain the API enablement of the TELUS Metadata Management Tool powered by Collibra through the entire lifecycle from design to deployment within the TELUS cloud environment
  • Work with the supporting teams, organizations and vendors to provide updates to existing deployed technologies and collect information from production systems for analysis
  • Define, enable, test and automate scripts for integration and process automation activities including documentation, work products and team presentations as well
  • Develop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products and solutions
  • Participate in agile development scrums and solutions reviews
  • Lead resolution of critical operations issues including post-implementation reviews
  • Contribute to the strategic direction and evolution of TELUS Enterprise Metadata & Data Quality Management application

 

 

Qualifications

 

You are the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are sought out for your strong understanding of Metadata Management, Data Quality, Data Lineage and Data Management
  • You are respected for your knowledge of Solution Development and Data Management Lifecycles
  • You are recognized for your understanding of integration patterns including RESTful architecture and patterns, APIs and event based processing
  • You are hands on in Windows Operating Systems, Unix, Linux, JSOn, Yaml, Swagger and with GCP Kubernetes (GKE), GCP Development and deployment using a CI/CD pipeline including Git, terraform, cloud build and deploy
  • You are commended for your expertise with Collibra - including managing system activities, tenant administration, user groups creation etc
  • You are recognized for your understanding of and experience with programming in JAVA especially Springboot or equivalent, with Collibra and Collibra APIs or GCP SDK experience
  • You are recognized for your understanding of and experience with Oracle, SQL server, GCP BigQuery,PostgreSQL,and NoSQL
  • You are an expert communicator and strategic thinker, able to provide a consultative approach in alignment with the Telco Management Industry Framework
  • You are an excellent and effective presenter able to communicate ideas in a clear and concise manner
  • You are an effective influencer and negotiator, able to be persuasive while upholding commitments to our customers, stakeholders and TELUS’ commitment to integrity
  • Fluency in speaking, reading and writing in English
  • 4+ years Data Engineering experience / 2 year data solution architecture and design

 

Great-to-Haves

 

  • University degree in computer science and/or 5 years of working experience in Information Management
  • Demonstrable DAMA international BOK Framework knowledge and/or application
  • Demonstrated TM Forum Frameworxs knowledge
  • Fluency in speaking, reading and writing in French

 

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering (MDM)
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, MDM & Business Operations Insights. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps of the enterprise data engineering team. The portfolio will focus specifically on the Master Data Management (MDM) workstream while also driving continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, batch and real-time data ingestion, and addressing technical debt. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission of driving value for TELUS via data enablement.

 

What you’ll do

 

At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

 

 

  • Lead a team of talented data Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team of data professionals

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You are flexible, adaptable and embrace ongoing change
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam), Kafka, MDM, IICS & PowerCentre ETL
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

item.title: Head of Data Transformation, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2023-05-12T11:00:34.791Z

Head of Data Transformation, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience across data, measurement and investigative roles.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with Google Marketing Platform, Google Cloud/Big Query product capabilities or similar technologies.
  • Experience in sales/operations management and strategic planning.
  • Experience as a mentor that showcases inclusive leadership, integrity and influence based leadership.
  • Ability to operate in a fast-moving and constantly evolving team environment.
  • Excellent analysis skills and the ability to lead teams on data preparation and extracting insights.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

In this role, you will lead a team of Data Transformation Leads to engage, educate and advance measurement priorities alongside partner teams and with customers. You will be an authority on ad tech, measurement, attribution, and solutions. You will build relationships and be an adviser, both internally and externally.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Be accountable for facilitating the implementation of Data, Measurement and Analytics plans for customers and Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance.
  • Support and help to advance relationships with executive internal/external stakeholders, becoming an advisor. 
  • Lead the business cycle for key Data, Measurement and Analytics capabilities, and project coordination and execution with internal and external stakeholders, develop use cases that deploy technology to solve customer business objectives.
  • Execute on the engagement model for key cross-functional partnerships in leadership forums with Director and VP stakeholders, and ensure support and service models are aligned.
  • Create alignment through joint business plans and joint technical plans, influencing cross-functionally to align strategy and resources across teams and attract, develop and grow the team.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

item.title: Technical Sales Specialist, Data Analytics, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-03-23T10:00:43.555Z

Technical Sales Specialist, Data Analytics, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with traditional Big Data technologies, Analytic Warehousing technologies, data processing technologies, performance and scalability optimizations.
  • Experience delivering technical presentations and live demonstrations in an enterprise business environment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with technical sales or professional consulting in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience with architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design, and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch/real-time event processing, streaming, data processing (ETL/ELT), data migrations, data visualization tools, and data governance on cloud native architectures.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing (e.g., infrastructure, storage, platforms, and data), cloud market, competitive dynamics, and customer buying behavior.

About the job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud it\'s a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Support local Sales teams in pursuit of key business opportunities, engaging customers to address aspects of the data lifecycle.
  • Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery, and design client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
  • Lead technical projects, including activities such as technology advocacy, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and Request for Information (RFI) response documents.
  • Work with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Travel as required for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

item.title: Field Sales Manager, Data Analytics, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-05-17T19:31:17.515Z

Field Sales Manager, Data Analytics, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 2 more locations
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Vancouver, BC, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in a sales role in the enterprise software space.
  • 3 years of experience developing, leading, and managing a team.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 12 years of experience with field sales in the technology industry, promoting Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) or Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS).
  • 5 years of experience managing and developing a team that carries and exceeds strategic business goals, supporting both business and career development.
  • Experience promoting Google Cloud computing technologies to organizations across geographies.
  • Product knowledge of market trends in Data Analytics in the Cloud with the ability to use key metrics to analyze, predict and react to business trends.
  • Understanding how Google Cloud technologies work together to drive deeper technology adoption within the existing account base.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Field Sales Manager, you will lead a team responsible for growing our Data Analytics business by building and expanding relationships with new and existing customers. You will ensure the team has the necessary selling skills to effectively build relationships with Cloud Field Sales Representatives (FSRs), Customer Specialists, and new and existing customers. You will support your team and their relationships with external customer stakeholders, leading with empathy, while identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole. You will have shared responsibility to uphold and grow an exceptional team culture. You will partner with internal Google Cloud Platform (GCP) sales teams to grow their data businesses and drive overall value for GCP.

Responsibilities

item.description:

Business Intelligence Sales Specialist, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:

  • + 3 more locations
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience selling Business Intelligence (BI) offerings.
  • Experience planning, pitching, and executing a territory sales strategy.
  • Experience prospecting for, proposing, and closing solutions in a specialist capacity.
  • Experience working with sales developers and customer’s technical leads to build business cases for transformation and the plan for implementation.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience at engaging and collaborating with executive stakeholders as a business advisor and thought leader in BI.
  • Experience executing commercial and legal agreements with procurement, legal, and business teams.
  • Experience and understanding of the Data Analytics (DA) technology stack.
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud DA offerings, especially BigQuery.
  • Excellent business judgment and analytics skills, using data to inform decisions and stakeholders.
  • Comfortable presenting to executives or C-level executives with a customer.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Business Intelligence Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for growing our Business Intelligence business by building and expanding relationships with customers. In this role, you will build relationships with both Cloud Data Analytics Sales Specialists (DASS), Field Sales Representatives (FSRs), Customer Developers, and customers. You will develop relationships with external customer stakeholders, identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole. You\'ll partner with internal the Google Cloud Product (GCP) sales teams to grow their Business Intelligence (BI) businesses and lead overall value for GCP.

Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.

For United States applicants: The US base salary range for this full-time position is $106,000-$163,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities

  • Own your number, calibrate the business against the Objectives and Key Results, and accurately forecast and report the state of the business for your territory.
  • Build executive relationships with customers as the Business Intelligence Subject Matter Expert, lead strategic direction for your customers as well as the Google Cloud Data Analytics Sales Specialists, Field Sales Representatives, and Customer Developers.
  • Develop and execute account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across verticals.
  • Assist customers in identifying use cases suitable for Google Cloud Business Intelligence solutions, and articulate solution differentiators and the measurable business impact.
  • Work with Google Account and technical teams to develop a pipeline and provide expertise. Execute sales plans and related efforts with the Cloud teams and Partners.
